abstract: British authorities begin clearing encampment east of London after Court of Appeal upholds ruling that occupation by its owners, so-called travelers, is unlawful; evictions are latest chapter of what has become test case to define status of travelers, who speak with Irish accents and are descendants of itinerants who arrived in England half century ago and have begun seeking to claim residential rights.
snippet: British authorities have been trying to clear an encampment east of London for years, arguing that it is supposed to be kept as open countryside.
lead_paragraph: British authorities have been trying to clear an encampment east of London for years, arguing that it is supposed to be kept as open countryside.

headline.main: British Police Clear Encampment, Home to Hundreds, After Ruling
headline.print_headline: British Police Clear Encampment, Home to Hundreds, After Ruling
headline.seo: British Police Clear ‘Travelers’ From Dale Farm
